verse.roman:
saric-chaila-vanoddeśā
gāvo veṇu-ravā ime
saṅkarṣaṇa-sahāyena
kṛṣṇenācaritāḥ prabho

synonyms: sarit—rivers; śaila—hills; vana-uddeśāḥ—and areas of the forest; gāvaḥ—cows; veṇu-ravāḥ—flute sounds; ime—all these; saṅkarṣaṇa—Lord Balarāma; sahāyena—whose companion; kṛṣṇena—by Kṛṣṇa; ācaritāḥ—utilized; prabho—O master (Uddhava).
translation: Dear Uddhava Prabhu, when Kṛṣṇa was here in the company of Saṅkarṣaṇa, He enjoyed all these rivers, hills, forests, cows and flute sounds.
